chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler K Ruehl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 2/01/2017; alternate 7 days. $15.00 payment plan fee to be added as well.
DNA surcharge to be paid with fine on payment plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler K Ruehl

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Tyler K Ruehl in court with attorney Bradley Jay Dagen.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge in the amended information. Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine $379.00
DNA Surcharge $200
Defendant to pay $50.00 a month commencing 02/01/2017 or alternate of 7 days consecutive
